messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the llvm-project program, here is the asan report

This is an LLVM error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

opt: /tmp/llvm-gh-134115/build/llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantRangeList.h:36: llvm::ConstantRangeList::ConstantRangeList(llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::ConstantRange>): Assertion `isOrderedRanges(RangesRef)' failed.
Stack dump:
0.	Program arguments: ./build/bin/opt -p function-attrs /testcases/llvm-gh-134115/input/poc.ll -disable-output
1.	Running pass "cgscc(function-attrs)" on module "/testcases/llvm-gh-134115/input/poc.ll"

    - PrintStackTraceSignalHandler(void*) llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc:880:1

    - llvm::ConstantRangeList::ConstantRangeList(llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::ConstantRange>) llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantRangeList.h:37:35
    - (anonymous namespace)::getArgumentAccessInfo(llvm::Instruction const*, (anonymous namespace)::ArgumentUse const&, llvm::DataLayout const&) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:700:73
    - (anonymous namespace)::collectArgumentUsesPerBlock(llvm::Argument&, llvm::Function&) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:809:34
    - inferInitializes(llvm::Argument&, llvm::Function&) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:1108:21
    - addArgumentAttrs(llvm::SmallSetVector<llvm::Function*, 8u> const&, llvm::SmallSet<llvm::Function*, 8u, std::less<llvm::Function*>>&, bool) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:1305:9
    - llvm::SmallSet<llvm::Function*, 8u, std::less<llvm::Function*>> deriveAttrsInPostOrder<llvm::PostOrderFunctionAttrsPass::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&)::'lambda'(llvm::Function&)&>(llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Function*>, llvm::PostOrderFunctionAttrsPass::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&)::'lambda'(llvm::Function&)&, bool) llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp:2266:18

    - llvm::detail::PassModel<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::PostOrderFunctionAttrsPass, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&>::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerInternal.h:92:3
    - llvm::PassManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&>::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&) llvm/lib/Analysis/CGSCCPassManager.cpp:93:12
    - llvm::detail::PassModel<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::PassManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&>, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&>::run(llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC, llvm::LazyCallGraph&>&, llvm::LazyCallGraph&, llvm::CGSCCUpdateResult&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerInternal.h:92:3
    - llvm::ModuleToPostOrderCGSCCPassAdaptor::run(llvm::Module&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>&) llvm/lib/Analysis/CGSCCPassManager.cpp:280:18
    - llvm::detail::PassModel<llvm::Module, llvm::ModuleToPostOrderCGSCCPassAdaptor, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>>::run(llvm::Module&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerInternal.h:92:3
    - llvm::PassManager<llvm::Module, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>>::run(llvm::Module&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerImpl.h:85:18

    - optMain llvm/tools/opt/optdriver.cpp:725:27
    - main llvm/tools/opt/opt.cpp:25:64

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

messages.message:
Invoking: `validate` with `{'patch': '--- a/llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp\n+++ b/llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp\n@@ -698,7 +698,13 @@\n     if (auto TypeAccessRange =\n             GetTypeAccessRange(LI->getAccessType(), ArgUse.Offset))\n-      return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, {*TypeAccessRange}};\n+      if (ConstantRangeList::isOrderedRanges(ArrayRef<ConstantRange>{*TypeAccessRange}))\n+        return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, {*TypeAccessRange}};\n+      else\n+        return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, {}};\n \n@@ -720,7 +720,13 @@\n     if (auto AccessRange =\n             GetConstantIntRange(MTI->getLength(), ArgUse.Offset))\n-      return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, {*AccessRange}};\n+      if (ConstantRangeList::isOrderedRanges(ArrayRef<ConstantRange>{*AccessRange}))\n+        return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, {*AccessRange}};\n+      else\n+        return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, {}};\n'}`
responded: The root cause of the crash is that the constructor of `ConstantRangeList` in `llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantRangeList.h` asserts that the input ranges are ordered (`assert(isOrderedRanges(RangesRef));`). However, in the call site in `getArgumentAccessInfo` (in `FunctionAttrs.cpp`), we have code like:

```c++
return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, {*TypeAccessRange}};
```

Here, a `ConstantRangeList` is constructed from a braced initializer list containing a single `ConstantRange`. If `TypeAccessRange` is not valid (e.g., if it is empty or has lower >= upper), this assertion can fail, causing the crash.

**The correct fix** is to ensure that we never construct a `ConstantRangeList` with an invalid or unordered range. This means we should check that `TypeAccessRange` is valid and ordered before constructing the list, and otherwise return an empty `ConstantRangeList`.

This pattern appears in multiple places in `getArgumentAccessInfo`. The fix is to check `TypeAccessRange` (and similar optionals) before constructing a `ConstantRangeList` from them.

Let's patch the relevant lines in `FunctionAttrs.cpp`:

- At line 700: `return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, {*TypeAccessRange}};`
- At line 721: `return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, {*AccessRange}};`

We should only construct a `ConstantRangeList` if the range is valid and ordered, otherwise return an empty list.

Here is the patch:

message.name: validate
message.result: patch found
